alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 4:24PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko NV has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Nevada... Marys River Near Deeth affecting Elko County. .Well above normal temperatures through this weekend will melt high elevation snowpack and increase river flows. For the Marys River...including Deeth...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Marys River Near Deeth. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, This is monitoring stage or about 365 cfs. No flooding occurs within the reach. At 6.0 feet, Flood stage, about 580 cfs. Minor lowland flooding on lower mary`s river, with minor flooding of rural roads throughout area. Some minor flooding of streets in deeth. At 6.8 feet, Minor to moderate lowland flooding occurs on lower mary`s river, with flooding of many rural roads near the river. Some streets in deeth flood, as well as basements and foundations of a few homes. This is about 800 cfs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM PDT Saturday the stage was 5.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue rising to 7.1 feet late Wednesday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.2 feet on 05/18/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
